question: A positively charged particle of mass m is passed through a velocity selector. It moves horizontally with a speed v. The electric field is vertically downwards and magnetic field is into the plane of the paper. Now, the electric field is switched off at $t=0$. The angular momentum of the charged particle about origin O at $t=\frac{\pi m}{qB}$ is
images/f8e9d0c1-b2a3-4b5c-6d7e-8f9a0b1c2d3e.png
explanation: At $t=\frac{\pi m}{qB}$ (half time period), the particle has moved in a semi-circle of radius $r = \frac{mv}{qB}$ to a position $y=2r$ and velocity $-v\hat{i}$.
Angular momentum $L = mvr_{\perp} = m(v)(2r) = 2m v \frac{mv}{qB} = \frac{2m^2 v^2}{qB}$.
Note: The source text marks 'Ans. A/None' but D is the derived result.
